did.abstract: The Lafayette Social of Brooklyn, N.Y. was a social club founded in 1878. The collection contains a handwritten record book with a constitution and bylaws, list of members, and meeting minutes, as well as loose treasurer's reports, resignation letters, and correspondence.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1987.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in two folders. The bound record book is in one folder and the loose documents in another.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Lafayette Social of Brooklyn, N.Y. was a social club founded in 1878.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lafayette Social of Brooklyn records, 1987.004; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a handwritten record book with a constitution and bylaws, list of members, and meeting minutes, as well as loose treasurer's reports, resignation letters, and correspondence.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.
